page.title: 19ENERGY
page.content: As there is no mains gas power in Harris people rely on other sources of power.Propane gas is used for cookers and heaters.Electricity is the main source of power.Hydro-electricity is produced at a generating station at Loch Chliostair.Power is carried overland to consumers as the rocky land makes burial of cables expensive and impractical.This makes them vulnerable to the weather,especially high winds;power cuts can be frequent particulary in winter.Most people have open fires on which they burn coal or peat.Peat is usually used and is cut from the moors around Tarbert,mainly during April and May.The dry peats are brought home during the summer.Working at the peats is a family activity,the oldest to the youngest have some job to do.Wind and wave power have been considered.
